alert.note: Alert for Clark; Clay; Crawford; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 1:37AM CST until March 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Illinois and southeast Illinois, including the following counties, in east central Illinois, Clark and Edgar. In southeast Illinois, Clay, Crawford, Jasper, Lawrence and Richland. * WHEN...From late tonight through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A round of moderate to heavy rainfall will likely produce 2 to 3 inches. This amount of rainfall may cause flooding of low-lying and poor drainage area, including small creeks and streams. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Clay; Crawford; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland
